summary: Richard N Billings is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports related to the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). These documents span from May 1978 to March 1979 and detail the employees of the committee, their positions, salaries, and pay period earnings. While the documents confirm Billings was an employee of the SCA, they do not specify his exact role or responsibilities within the committee. The consistent appearance of his name across multiple payroll reports indicates sustained involvement with the SCA during the specified period.
significance: The significance of Richard N Billings lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. The documents suggest he was a staff member, but without further information, his specific contribution to the investigation into the JFK assassination cannot be determined.
